intro: Heisteria salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf heister, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct willow-like appearance, giving it its common name. Heisteria salicifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks.
